snippet: The National Transportation Safety Board is looking at the flight crew’s inputs into the autopilot and other cockpit automation systems during Asiana Flight 214’s final minutes.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board is looking at flight crew’s inputs into autopilot and other cockpit automation systems during Asiana Flight 214’s final minutes before crashing at San Francisco International Airport; says none of three pilots mentioned airspeed in nearly 30 seconds before impact.
lead_paragraph: The National Transportation Safety Board is looking at the flight crew’s inputs into the autopilot and other cockpit automation systems during Asiana Flight 214’s final minutes.

headline.main: Safety Board Reconstructs Crew Actions Before Crash
headline.print_headline: Safety Board Reconstructs Crew Actions Before Crash
